pros: Collaboration, Vertical and lateral growth, and Transparency. Great organization culture. Very friendly and knowledgeable HR.
cons: I can't say I've experienced any thus far but work is fast paced which may be difficult for some.

job_title: Junior, Software Engineer in Miami, FL
pros: Good Beneficts and good work enviroment.
cons: Low Salary and not so interested technical problems.

job_title: Senior Data Specialist in Doral, FL
pros: Health Choice Network is a wonderful company who genuinely cares about it's employees. HCN allows us flexible schedules, remote work options and amazing benefits. Our leadership team mentors, encourages and rewards our work. There is no other organization I would rather work for.
cons: The only downside I can think of is the commute from Broward but our remote work options make that a non-issue these days.

pros: The work helps a great cause. Some management is good
cons: Some other management is really bad.

review_title: Great Place to Work and devote your time to.
pros: Amazing place to work, with lots of room for growth.  Really proud we are moving the low performers out (see negative reviews below)  Its time we took charge and made things happen.  Low performers out and High Performers to the front of the line.  Leadership works hard to do as much as they can with the little they are given.  Most of our resources are devoted to the Health Centers, but we get paid fair and the work is rewarding.  HR is the best I have ever seen.  They care for the employees and make every effort to make this a wonderful place to work.  Kevin is the best CEO to work for.  Where else can you have lunch with the CEO and enjoy it!
cons: Leadership is working hard for the centers and some days they are pulled thin.  But they bounce back because they realize they have an amazing team.

review_title: Stuck in the corporate hamster wheel, wishing the company mission statement was a reality.
pros: Great people to work with other than mgmt. interdepartmental support is wonderful and a large group of varied backgrounds and cultures from the employees and all are equally celebrated. very family oriented staff.
cons: Salaries are low and stagnant. Information isn't shared across depts. and isn't shared by mgmt. No real open door policy. No confidentiality or real HR dept. Poor career advancement and occasionally deliberately holding people back for political and/or personal reasons. Low opportunities for training. Thankless. Employees are treated as bodies/machines/a number not actual human beings. Raises aren't given regularly and when they are they are not even the cost the living increase, usually 1 or 2% at most.

review_title: Great people to work with, but pay and benefits are substandard
job_title: Client Support Administrator in Miami, FL
pros: Managers and Directors are fair, encouraging and a pleasure to work with.  They offer many opportunities for knowledge growth and are extremely supportive.  They are family oriented and very accomodating for presonal and family needs.
cons: The pay scale is horrifically low and the hours and demands can be very high.  Raises when given are often delayed for several months.

review_title: A non profit with poor morale!
pros: The best thing about working at HCN is the location.  Its right off of the major roadways.
cons: Executive management does not care about lower level employees.  Employees do not have a place to go if treated unfairly and are forced to deal with their issues in silence.

pros: Great people to work with other than mgmt. interdepartmental support is wonderful and a large group of varied backgrounds and cultures from the employees and all are equally celebrated. very family oriented staff.
cons: The pay scale is horrifically low and the hours and demands can be very high. Raises when given are often delayed for several months.

pros: Good Pay and good working environment (However, must have thick skin to work in some of the departments) Too much improper situations (jokes, bullying, favoritism)
cons: Management is constantly changing focus and directives and for the most part is not communicated back to the employees. Lots of responsibilities not much help. No holiday bonuses to staff. :(

review_title: Unprofessional, lot of dead wood, that should not be there
job_title: Case Management and UR in Miami, FL
pros: Its in Miami, its a nice city! They get you a nice one time meal when you start
cons: super crazy workload expectations daily, harassment from management to director level who do not know what they are doing themselves, non existent training run  for the hills.

pros: PTO, Insurance for family over 1500 a month??? Seriously? Shame on you HCN!
cons: Poor communication with employee's, Poor HR presence, Scandals are covered up and hidden from CEO, Leaders lacks education and integrity

pros: Mission driven, competitive pay, leaders and managers care about employees, excellent vacation time model.
cons: Driving to Doral is a pain, promotions are hard to come by, lack of organizational structure b

pros: Really believe in Work,Life,Balance,Family oriented corporation always encouraged advancement.
